alert.note: Alert for Tuscaloosa; Walker (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 24 at 2:09PM CST until January 28 at 7:12PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Tuscaloosa and Walker. * WHEN...Until 515 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 209 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tuscaloosa, Northport, Holt, Moundville, Brookwood, Coaling, Coker, Binion Creek Landing, Tuscaloosa Amphitheater, Tuscaloosa Regional Airport, Bryant Denny Stadium, Samantha, Lake Lurleen State Park, University Mall, Deerlick Creek Campgrounds, McFarland Mall, Shelton State Community College, Lake Wildwood, Bankhead Lock And Dam and Bull City.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
